intro: Psychotria asekiensis, commonly known as the Aseki Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its striking dark green leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
